Good software, especially for free and I really enjoyed the experience. However, the load times between each tiny room is excructiating with just standing there in the dark for what feels like two minutes at a time. Other than that, it does an amazing job recreating the place where Anne Frank was forced to hide during the Nazi regime.

review_title: VR Done Right. No Sickness. Perfect Pic
one_reviews_text: This is a super Vr Realism Experience showing the actual place Anne Frank lived.  Most of the negative reviews mention motion sickness or bad picture. Hah! Not in a million years. Those folks need to adjust their VR settings (or are new to Vr). If they think this is bad, they'd better not try a game with real motion and fast movement like an action game!!  No, this is superior photo quality and fully 3D with audio dialogue. It IS an historical walkthrough, but I've seen good VR and bad, and this is not only flawless in appearance but quite interesting if you're interested in the inside of places lived during WWII. It's one of the games I've replayed about 3 times now and for a walkthrough with no action and no real-time, that's saying a lot. It's just you and the narrator, like a tour. But, unless you're just immature or really don't get how to set up your VR so you can see right, this is a top rate one. Short, sweet, and worth every minute!
This was kind of amazing. The sense of presence and scale just makes this a really unforgettable piece of living history.
good

I went through this experience a few months ago when it was released as a 3DOF experience, being ported from the Go. The product itself was top notch, and the kind of worthy title you should show to your kids, it's the sort of experience that justifies VR as a technology. The lack of 6DOF made it pretty uncomfortable however. I haven't tried the update on my Rift S yet but it did hit the Quest a couple weeks ago and I was thoroughly impressed with it on there. As a free app its an essential download if you care at all about history, humanity, morality or cullture.
review_feedback: Please check out our update which is a full 6DOF experience!

one_reviews_text: The first version was bad, but after the update everything changed to roomscale, so you get a perfect surround VR-expeience. The app is nice to use, you can walk around and listen to the story if you want, or skip it at any place.  Perfect to use, and interesting to watch. It's not a game of course.
That is a great example of combining modern technology and the ability to learn from the past!
A powerful experience supporting full room scale.
Super slow load times but still worth the wait. A highly recommended experience.

review_title: This is how history should be taught
one_reviews_text:
1st off, there is a huge bug in this experience. Its not so much a bug, but more of how they built it. You are basically viewing 360 degree pre-rendered photos. That means when you move in real life, the game or app doesnt register this movement. So if you stand up and walk closer to a wall inside Anne's room, you will still be in the same exact spot as you were. 

This is bad because your brain registered that your body should be moving in a 3D space, but it didnt. This causes VR sickness. What the developers should have done was create an entirely explorable house with either teleport or joystick walking. Reference the free VR game Rec Room to see how to do walking, teleporting and flying correctly in VR without causing any VR sickness. 

As it stands, this app is very informative and I sat through the entire 22 minute experience in story mode, and it was very moving, interesting as well as educational. I wish we had VR in schools when I was younger, as something like this would have shut up the kids who didnt want to learn and make them experience history as close as possible to really being there. And for the rest of us who were in school to learn, this would have really enriched our education making us experience what life was like back then instead of just reading about it.

So if the developers are listening, please work with the Oculus team and make this a full walk/teleport/fly experience in the style of Rec Room VR. Also, please create some VR hands for us to use in this app. Having hands in VR that you can use to pick up objects, open doors, touch things and open app menus is another important way to ease VR sickness as the brain starts to believe you are inside there instead of trapped in a bubble where you cant move even though you feel your body moving. You could even make the hands look like authentic gloves from the 1940's to really enrich the experience, and allow us to interact with everything we see in the app.
review_feedback: Good news!  We have updated the Anne Frank House VR experience to full room-scale.  Please update your app.

one_reviews_text:
The content is very well done. But it's must be a port from mobile, since this is just 3DOF images (at least 3D), making you sick if you lean anywhere. PLEASE, redo it in Unreal or Unity with 6DOF - the impact will be so much more, and it will be magnitudes more comfortable.
Since it's free, I still recommend it. Just take it sitting and look around slowly.

review_title: Informative, but lacks a bit technically
one_reviews_text:
This experience delivers exactly what it needs to - a brief insight into Anne Frank's house and diary extracts.

In terms of technical points - the entire environment is pre-rendered (bar a few dust particles). Unfortunately this means that the eye spacing is a little off depending on your headset configuration, leading to some fuzziness. This also means that you cannot move your head around the space, and really immerse yourself. However, due to the high quality of the render, I can understand why it has been done this way to make it look as realistic as possible without the expense on the GPU to render a realistic dynamic environment.

My girlfriend tried this experience and she is shorter than most - due to the (what I assume is) pre-rendered nature, she felt very tall and displaced throughout the experience, as did I for that matter.

Technical points aside, the experience is a great insight into a place and time I'll never get to visit, and the story telling through simple points of interest crossed with in world subtitles is effective.
review_feedback: Good news! We have updated the Anne Frank House VR experience to full room-scale. Please update your app.

review_title: This is terrible for many reasons
one_reviews_text: There is something wrong with the 3D making you feel like you are going cross-eyed while watching. Also, it is not moving, not accurate and is in fact, offensive if you know your history. I wouldn't recommend this for anyone.

Heartbraking listening to the voice as you stand in the cramped rooms, getting a small feeling for how terrible it must of been.

The rooms are nicely rendered but it would have been nice to have even a small amount of free movement.
This is a great tour of the house. I feel like I've been there. I recommed story mode to get the full background for Anne and her family.

I've visited the Anne Frank house and whilst it was an experience not to be missed, it left me feeling that I wish I could get more of a feeling of how it was like to be there in the 1940's.  It felt like a museum.   This however, supplements the experience really well in that you feel like you are standing in the rooms as they were at the time and it generates a real atmosphere.

There are problems with the App.   Your position is fixed so when you move your head towards something it moves away from you etc. It would be fantastic if they could create free movement.     Also, the odd item can be clicked on for viewing and a bit of narrative - but these are few and far between and make you want to inspect more.

Hopefully the developers will expand on this experience further but this is well worth a download and an absolute must for anyone interested in Anne Frank and the house.

Most of the time 360 videos feel completely flat. This one has stereoscopic depth perception so it's way above most 360 video content and it lets you explore her house room to room not just passively watch a video.
I'm all for telling Anne Frank's story again in VR so kudos to the developer.
These days we need to remind young people of her story now more than ever.

one_reviews_text: Nice rendering, only the B&W pictures are too small and out of focus but everithing is smooth. Nice surrounding sounds.

The story mode is amazing, while I know about Anne Frank and her struggles, seeing where this all took place and hearing her day-to-day left a deep impact on me. Sure, people have complained about sections of the images not being perfect for VR, but I can't give this a lower rating because I may never travel to Amsterdam and see it for myself. As with most experiences, it seems people are easily thrown off by technicalities rather than a beautiful, albeit dark and frightening, story.

Pros:
-I like the idea. I loved the education aspect and how you can explore.

Cons:
-Cross Eye Effect and/or Bad HMD Pivot (Can't Tell)
-Very limited on user movement, user can't move and closely inspect certain things. 

Overall I loved the experience

review_title: Alforno1 should be banned from Oculus
one_reviews_text: This is an amazing, meaninful experience. We get to tour where Ann Frank lived in hiding and wrote her now famous book The Diary of a Young Girl. I did not experience any cross-eyed effect. I think the environment looked good on both the Oculus Rift and the Oculus Go (one of the best on the Go in fact). I recommend doing the story mode versus doing the tour, especially on your first experience. I think the people complaining about Volumetric 3D are being unreasonable as there is no VR with that except for the Google app (Welcome to Light Fields) which is a demo of the technology that is possible. Anyways, Alforno1 and other Nazis like him and everyone who liked his post should be banned from Oculus. We don't need people who deny the holocaust happened or what happened to Ann Frank is fake news. They are so filled with hate that they need to deny history to justify their racism. These are the same brutes that Ann Frank described in her diary. You can't reason with them. Facebook really needs better moderators.

A truly exceptional experience I can highly recommend to anyone. The only caveat is that it seems to be designed for GearVR and Go first so its 3DoF only but storywise its an easy 5-star review. Never been so close to the horrors of her conditions actually.
